description.narrative:
FAO har ansökt om finansiering från Sida på 25 miljoner kronor för att genomföra projektet “Resilient rural communities for the peace building in Colombia” under perioden 2016-2019.
Insatsen är i linje med den svenska strategin för utvecklingssamarbete med Colombia 2009-2016. Strategins övergripande mål är att fattiga människor har förbättrat sina levnadsvillkor och att hållbar fred uppnås med en bred social delaktighet. Insatsen är relevant då den syftar till att utveckla resilienta lokalsamhällen och bemöta de direkta orsakerna till utsatthet, osäker livsmedelsförsörjning och undernäring, samtidigt som människors och lokala myndigheters kapacitet stärks för effektiv förberedelse inför framtida chocker. I det svenska samarbetet med Colombia ingår humanitärt stöd bl.a. i samarbete med FAO. Att bygga resiliens i Colombia är ett led i att stärka det colombianska samhället att självständigt kunna hantera den utsatta befolkningen och på sikt möjliggöra ett ökat oberoende av det humanitära stödet. Att samarbeta med FAO inom en långsiktig insats främjar en effektiv övergång från det humanitära stödet till det bilaterala. Med mångårig erfarenhet i Colombia besitter FAO en relevant kapacitet vilket ökar en ändamålsenlig användning av de svenska resurserna.
De samhällen som prioriteras i insatsen är de mest utsatta som drabbats av både konflikt och extrema väderförändringar p.g.a. ett försämrat klimat. Insatsen bidrar till jordbruksutveckling och fredsbyggande genom att: att stärka nationella myndigheters förmåga att främja resilent jordbrukspolitik i utsatta områden; att stärka lokal teknisk kapacitet för hantering (utformning, genomförande och utvärdering) av resilienta jordbrukt på landsbygden och i sårbara samhällen; och återställa möjligheten till livsmedelsförsörjning genom jordbruk i utsatta samhällen. FAO kommer att genomföra insatsen tillsammans med nationella och lokala myndigheter.
Insatsens totala budget är 41 miljoner kronor, varav DPS (myndigheten med ansvar för social utveckling) har manifesterat sin avsikt att avsätta 16 miljoner kronor (2 miljoner USD) och reaming 25 miljoner kronor (3 miljoner USD). Cirka 360 000 kronor av det svenska bidraget kommer att gå till lokala leverantörer av tjänster genom lokala avtal.

FAO has applied to Sida for funding of 25 million SEK to carry out a project called “Resilient rural communities for the peace building in Colombia” during the period 2016-2019. The intervention aims at strengthening resilience of vulnerable rural communities affected by the conflict and extreme climatic events in prioritized areas, as a contribution to the agricultural development and peace building in Colombia by: 1) Strengthening national authorities capabilities to M&E resilient agricultural projects for rural vulnerable community exposed to conflict and extreme weather events. 2) Strengthening local technical capacities for the management (design, implementation, and evaluation) of resilient agricultural projects in vulnerable rural communities. 3) Recovering agricultural livelihoods of vulnerable communities. FAO will implement the intervention together with national and local authorities. The intervention total budget is 41 million SEK, out of which DPS has manifest its intention to allocate 16 million SEK (2 million USD) funding and the reaming 25 million SEK (3 million USD) is contributed by Sida. Approximately 360 000 SEK of Swedish contribution will be allocated to local services providers in the territories through local agreements.

description.narrative: On the second year of intervention, this contribution has delivered the planned results for the three results initially addressed: R 1. Technical capacities at the national level: The development of the protocol for national institutional interchange on information on double affected communities by natural disasters and social facts that was accomplished during the 1st year has been used and adapted on a pedagogic exercise with sub-national institutions. R 2. Technical capacities at the sub-national level: This result, as well as R.3, have been the main focus during the 2nd year of intervention. Formulated and implemented projects for agricultural subsistence have been identified as the main output for the 500 hour training program included in the contribution (diplomado) named "Strenthening of territorial capacities for the recovery of agricultural production as an instrument for peace-building in Colombia". This training program has been discussed and developed by representative educative institutions in each of the territories of the projects and includes five modules: 1) Mapping of civil society affection condition: armed conflict and climate events, 2) Technical proposal for climate risk reduction adapted to territorial context, 3) recovery of subsistence means and agricultural production, 4) Non-formal training for recovery of agricultural production and 5) Formulated project for the recovery of agricultural production in double-affected communities (conflict and climate events). Throughout the training program, gender equality and environmental sustainability have been mainstreamed. The training program is directed to institutional workers as well as civil society organizations and producer organisations in the field, which has created ownership of the actions in the territories. However, the high rotation of public workers and a greater participation of women representatives from the farmer's organisations have been challenges to be addressed permanently. Currently, there are 205 participants of this training program (56% men and 44% women) that will be in charge of developing agricultural production projects for the 2.765 families in the 5 departments. R 3. Agricultural livelihoods: For now, there have been tow main activities under this result. First, the training program for strengthening sub-national institutional capacities (the "diplomado" mentioned above); and second, workshops for the strengthening of community capacities. For the latter, there was a selection of 189 representatives form agricultural/farmer associations in the territories that belong to the 2.765 beneficiary families. These representatives have been trained through the National Training Service in Colombia (SENA) on agricultural production, food security and nutritional education and agricultural-climatic risk management as well as on labor competences and associative techniques. The spirit of these workshops is to engage the farmer representatives as community promoters on agricultural production and climate risks managers. Another outcome of this result has been the identification and promotion of a rapid response model for the transition to development. This activity consists on integrating social and productive recovery with social and economic stabilisation towards sustainable income generation. For this, 365 families have been selected and accompanied on the strengthening of producer activities to increase agricultural production. What is expected for this last outcome at the end of year 3 is to have a diagnose on the producer organizations to which these families belong to on terms of associative, financial, administrative, technical assistance, environmental sustainability, production, markets and information technologies issues. Furthermore, there will be and identification of the agricultural production of these families in order to identify market distribution opportunities that may ensure sustainable incomes.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
